content.question: The magnitudes of the electric fields at the four labeled points in the figure are <math alttext="E sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="E sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="E sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , and <math alttext="E sub U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , respectively. Which of the following correctly ranks the points according to the magnitude of their electric fields?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub R equals E sub S, which equals E sub T, which equals E sub U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub S is greater than E sub T, which is greater than open parenthesis, E sub R equals E sub U, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, E sub S equals E sub T, close parenthesis, which is greater than E sub U, which is greater than E sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub T is greater than E sub S, which is greater than E sub R, which is greater than E sub U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis E sub S equals E sub T close parenthesis, which is greater than open parenthesis E sub R, equals E sub U close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub S is greater than E sub T, which is greater than open parenthesis, E sub R equals E sub U, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
